intro: Iposues obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Iposues obovata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
